question: What was "Hallgrimur Petursson" famous for?
explanation: Hallgrimur Petursson was an Icelandic poet and a minister. He was one of the most prominent Icelandic poets. He was one of the most influential pastors during the Age of Orthodoxy (1580â€“1713). Because of his contributions to Lutheran hymnody, he is sometimes called the Icelandic Paul Gerhardt.
